mosinstall.name: Date2
mosinstall.author: Ryan Rhode
mosinstall.description:
This module shows the current time and date.
Be sure to configure the module parameters to your liking.
Tip: You can use html too! For example:   entered in a text box or as a separator will become a space.
Information:
Daylight Saving Time / Summer Time: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daylight_saving_time
ISO 8601 Format: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable), this allows individual module styling.

param.name: pretext
param.label: Pre-text
param.description: This is the Text or HTML that is displayed before the module.

param.name: posttext
param.label: Post-text
param.description: This is the Text or HTML that is displayed after the module.

param.name: align
param.label: Alignment
param.description: The alignment of the date and time.

param.name: method
param.label: Use PHP or Javascript method to generate date and time
param.description:
Javascript will generate the date and time using Javascript and will update in realtime.

PHP will generate the date and time using PHP.

param.name: showdate
param.label: Display Date?
param.description: Do you wish to display the date?

param.name: predate
param.label: Date prefix
param.description:
Text displayed before the date.
i.e. Date: 02/24/2007
Leave blank to display nothing.

param.name: postdate
param.label: Date suffix
param.description:
Text displayed after the date.
i.e. 02/24/2007 Date
Leave blank to display nothing.

param.name: showtime
param.label: Display Time?
param.description: Do you wish to display the time?

param.name: pretime
param.label: Time prefix
param.description:
Text displayed before the time.
i.e. Time: 4:49pm
Leave blank to display nothing.

param.name: posttime
param.label: Time suffix
param.description:
Text displayed after the time.
i.e. 05:00 hours
Leave blank to display nothing.

param.name: order
param.label: Display order of date and time
param.description: Which to display first, the date or the time?

param.name: seplines
param.label: Show on separate lines or on the same line?
param.description: Choose to display the date and time on two separate lines or on the same line.

param.name: dateorder
param.label: Display order of date
param.description:
Order of the parts of the date.

w=day of the week
(Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

d=day of the month
(21st, 22nd, etc.)

m=month
(March, April, etc.)

y=year
(2007, 2008, etc.)

Simply leave a part out if you don't wish to display it.

Example:
Entering [w,d,m,y] will display [Monday, 4th June 2007] but entering only [d,m,y] will display [4th June 2007].

Hint: Don't use the brackets [ ] just the letters and commas.

param.name: ISO8601
param.label: Use ISO 8601 date format
param.description: Disregard most options and output date in ISO 8601 format. (requires PHP5 if using PHP method) For more information see module description above for URL.

param.name: zone
param.label: Time zone offset
param.description:
Time zone offset in hours. Only enter a number of hours here. For example -5 or +3 works fine.

When using PHP method this is only an offset of hours from the server and does not relate to your time zone.

param.name: dst
param.label: Automatic switching of DST / Summer Time
param.description:
Automatically compensate for Daylight Saving Time / Summer Time. For more information see module description above for URL.

Javascript uses the times below to determine when to adjust the time.

PHP automatically detects this from the server and does not use those dates. You will usually want to shut this off when using PHP method if your server adjusts its time automatically.

param.name: dston
param.label: DST / Summer Time Begins
param.description:
Date and time Daylight Saving Time / Summer Time begins. You can enter any year but the format must match this exactly: [March 14, 1999 2:59:59] For more information see module description above for URL.

PHP method automatically detects Daylight Savings Time / Summer Time.

param.name: dstoff
param.label: DST / Summer Time Ends
param.description:
Date and time Daylight Saving Time / Summer Time ends. You can enter any year but the format must match this exactly: [November 7, 1999 2:59:59] For more information see module description above for URL.

PHP method automatically detects Daylight Savings Time / Summer Time.
